title: Chinese Shiyan-10 satellite reappears in new Molniya orbit months after launch anomaly
summary: Classified Chinese Shiyan-10 has been tracked operating in a specialized orbit, six months after an anomaly during launch appeared to leave it stranded in an initial transfer orbit.

title: NASA Coverage Set for Axiom Mission 1 Departure from Space Station
summary: NASA will provide live coverage of the undocking and departure of the Axiom Mission 1 (Ax-1) prior to its return to Earth from the International Space Station.

title: SpaceX begins stress-testing upgraded Super Heavy booster
summary: In a probable prelude to engine installation, SpaceX has begun stress-testing an upgraded Super Heavy booster prototype. Known as Super Heavy Booster...

title: Rocket Report: NASA scrubs third SLS fueling test, Pythom Space strikes back
summary: "We want that future and that vision to come from Boca Chica."

title: Coverage Set for NASA’s SpaceX Crew-4 Briefing, Events, Broadcast
summary: NASA will provide coverage of the upcoming prelaunch and launch activities for the agency’s SpaceX Crew-4 mission sending astronauts to the International Space Station.

title: NASA halts third attempt at SLS practice countdown
summary: NASA cut short a third attempt to load propellants onto the Space Launch System for a countdown rehearsal April 14 after encountering several problems, including a hydrogen leak.

title: Astranis eyes U.S. military customers for its small geostationary satellites
summary: Small GEO satellite operator Astranis sees an opportunity to break into the defense market as the military seeks to diversify its communications architecture

title: Avanti sheds $550 million of debt to free up growth plan
summary: British satellite operator Avanti said April 13 it has cut its $810 million debt pile by two-thirds after investors agreed to swap debt for equity.

title: NASA Invites Media to Cover Boeing’s Orbital Flight Test-2 Mission
summary: Media accreditation is open for prelaunch and launch activities for NASA’s Boeing Orbital Flight Test-2 (OFT-2) mission to the International Space Station, the second uncrewed flight test of the company’s CST-100 Starliner spacecraft for the agency’s Commercial Crew Program.

title: Space domain awareness: A secret weapon against shadowy threats in orbit
summary: KBR, a Defense Department and NASA contractor with $6 billion in annual sales, paid $800 million in 2020 to acquire Centauri, a company focused on space sensors and satellite tracking. The acquisition gave KBR an entry into the business of “space domain awareness,” a military term for the capability to track objects in space and predict potential threats.
